content.title: Internship Scheme Of The Department Of Economic Affairs
content.details: The Department of Economic Affairs of the Ministry of Finance manages the Internship Scheme for PhD or postgraduate students working on specific issues relating to macro-economic management, capital Markets, Economic Reforms, Exchange Management, Foreign Investment in India and India Investment abroad, Monetary Policy, Fiscal Policy, Inflation Management, Debt Market Operation and Debt Management (External & Domestic), Small Savings, Modernization of Budget Documents, Bilateral Investment Treaties, Infrastructure Financing, etc.
benefits: Token remuneration of ₹10,000/- per month per intern for PG students
Token remuneration of ₹20,000/- per month per intern for PhD students
Logistics support including office space and computer with internet facility
Certificate of Internship upon satisfactory completion
eligibility: Outstanding Candidates pursuing Post Graduation or PhD in Economics/ Law/ Finance/ Management from Universities/ Institutions within the top 25 ranks as per the National Institutional Ranking Framework
Applications can be refused without assigning any reasons
exclusions: This program is not meant for graduate students
content.application_process: Online application process through the MoF-DEA Internship Application Link.
documents_required: Proof of the Latest Educational Qualification (Passing Certificate / Degree / Marksheet)
Identity Card / Proof of Enrolment into a Post Graduation or PhD Program in Economics/ Law/ Finance/ Management
Letter of Recommendation from the Institution

faqs.question: Can The Students Pursuing Their Postgraduation Course Apply To This Internship?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is open to students pursuing Post Graduation or a PhD.

faqs.question: Can Students From All The Universities In India Apply For This Internship?
faqs.answer: Only the students from the Universities/ Institutions which are within the top 25 ranks as per the National Institutional Ranking Framework can apply for this Internship.

faqs.question: Under What Circumstances, Can The Tenure Of An Internship Be Ended Prematurely?
faqs.answer: Interns, whose performance is unsatisfactory, may be relieved prematurely.

faqs.question: Can This Internship Be Regarded As A Job Assurance By The Department Of Economic Affairs?
faqs.answer: This internship is neither a job nor any such assurance thereof in the Department of Economic Affairs.

faqs.question: What Shall Be The Deliverables On The Part Of The Interns?
faqs.answer: The interns will have to present a Report/ Paper on the allotted subject to the concerned Divisional Head at the end of the internship.

faqs.question: Can I Apply Offline For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, this scheme only accepts online applications.

faqs.question: Is The Letter Of Recommendation From The Institution A Mandatory Document?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Letter of Recommendation from the Institution is mandatory for the successful submission of the application.

faqs.question: What Shall Be The Amount Of The Token Remuneration For PG Students?
faqs.answer: The Token remuneration will be ₹10,000/- per month per intern for PG students.

faqs.question: What Shall Be The Amount Of The Token Remuneration For PhD Students?
faqs.answer: The Token remuneration will be ₹20,000/- per month per intern for PhD students.

faqs.question: When Will The Remuneration Become Payable?
faqs.answer: The token remuneration is payable on satisfactory completion of their internship.

faqs.question: Will The Logistics Support Be Provided To The Interns By The DEA?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Interns will be provided with the necessary logistics support.
